Iwo Zalarre står på kanten av en balkong och pekar ner på en blek trollkarl i akademisk klädsel. Trollkarlen, som har många piercingar i kroppen, verkar sköta sitt eget ärende medan han läser en bok. Bredvid honom lutar en stav med en snidad av ett ormhuvud.

Iwo viskar: "Våra utredare rapporterar att den här mannen troligen är en kultist av Zehir den dolda ormen, en av förrädargudarna. Dina order är att följa honom tillbaka till hans hem och, utan att orsaka en scen, ta reda på varför han är här. Om det är för att orsaka problem, grip honom och överlämna honom till Ords händer. Rapportera tillbaka till mig när du är klar."
Den intressanta personen är en kaotisk ond halvälv vid namn {@creature Laurin Ophidas|CRCotN}. Han använder {@creature cult fanatic} statblocket, med dessa ändringar:

items: Han är immun mot giftskador och {@condition poisoned}.
Han använder en {@item staff of the adder} och är inställd på den som om han vore en präst.

entries.name: Ophidas's Motives
entries: {@creature Laurin Ophidas|CRCotN} är en vanärad medlem av Cerberus Assembly, en organisation av trollkarlar i Dwendalian Empire i Wildemount. Han flydde från den organisationen efter att ha stulit en {@item staff of the adder} från en överordnad. Ophidas är övertygad om att församlingens lönnmördare förföljer honom och försöker hitta andra Zehir-kultister i staden som kan skydda honom. Hans sökande går inte särskilt bra.

entries.name: Following Ophidas
entries: Strax efter att karaktärerna fått sina order lämnar Ophidas Mentorns tempel på dåligt humör och hämtar en vagn som tar honom tillbaka till sitt logi i Scroll's Alcove, en ståtlig lägenhet i Sigil District (se område S5 på {@adventure Streets of the Sigil District map|CRCotN|4|Streets of the Sigil District}). Karaktärerna kan följa honom i en egen vagn, till en kostnad av 2 sp per passagerare.

entries.name: Showdown
entries: Karaktärer som konfronterar Ophidas kan tvinga honom att avslöja den information de söker på något av följande sätt:

items: En karaktär kan använda en handling för att försöka övertala Ophidas att avslöja sina motiv och lyckas med en lyckad DC 16 Charisma ({@skill Intimidation})-kontroll.
Om Ophidas har halva sina träffpunkter eller mindre, ger han upp och svarar på alla frågor som karaktärerna ställer till honom.

entries: Om personerna förhör Ophidas offentligt ropar han efter Ord-handen. Fem Hands of Ord {@creature Knight||knights} anländer 3 rundor senare. Om karaktärerna fortfarande är i närheten när Hands anländer försöker vakterna gripa dem och hålla dem kvar över natten. Om de inte gör motstånd hålls karaktärerna kvar i ett fängelse i Sigildistriktet, och släpps sedan nästa morgon och åläggs en böter på 50 gp vardera för att ha stört freden. Medan karaktärerna svalnar i fängelset hämtar Ophidas (som förhörs av Hands of Ord men inte arresteras) sina tillhörigheter och försvinner. Karaktärerna har ingen chans att hitta honom igen.

entries.name: Success
entries: Om karaktärerna rapporterar tillbaka till Iwo med sanningen om Ophidas motiv försäkrar Iwo karaktärerna att de kommer att bli tillfrågade igen om några dagar och ger dem en sten från ett par {@item sending stones} för framtida kommunikation.

entries.name: Failure
entries: Om karaktärerna inte lyckas ta reda på Ophidas motiv innan han försvinner, säger Iwo att de måste arbeta sig upp till bibliotekarier innan han ger dem ett nytt uppdrag. Även om denna väg så småningom kan leda till fullt medlemskap vet karaktärerna att de inte kan vänta så länge för att avslöja Apotheons mysterier, så de måste hitta en annan fraktion att ansluta sig till.

entries.name: Cobalt Soul Mission 2: Half-Baked Scheme
entries: Karaktärernas andra uppdrag för Cobalt Soul innebär att de ska spana efter Old Man Kruuk, en halvorc-bager som misstänks för att vara en leverantör av stöldgods. Deras lugna övervakning exploderar till en rasande jakt över kanalerna när karaktärerna försöker hålla kraftfull magi borta från fel händer.

entries.name: Getting the Mission
entries: Sju dagar efter att karaktärerna har slutfört sitt första uppdrag skickar Iwo Zalarre ett meddelande till en av dem via {@item Sending Stones||sending stone}. Den karaktär som har den matchande stenen får meddelandet, som ser ut som följer:
"Är du fortfarande intresserad av att ansluta dig till Cobalt Soul? Möt mig vid Mentorns tempel. Jag har ett annat uppdrag åt dig."
När karaktärerna återförenas med Iwo i Mentorns tempel, läs:

Iwo visar dig en karta över staden, med en cirkel som visar var du befinner dig i floddistriktet. "Vi misstänker att en lokal bagare vid namn Kruuk är inblandad i olaglig försäljning av farliga magiska föremål, men vi behöver bevis innan vi involverar Hands of Ord. Cirkeln på kartan visar var bageriet ligger. Vi antar att Kruuk gör alla sina svarta affärer efter solnedgången, när bageriet stänger. Jag föreslår att ni väntar tills dess med att närma er platsen."
Iwo ber karaktärerna att utföra följande uppgifter:

items: Skaffa bevis för att Old Man Kruuk säljer magiska föremål på den svarta marknaden.
Konfiskera alla magiska föremål som hittats i Kruuks bageri och för dem till Iwo.

entries: Iwo betalar karaktärerna 250 gp i förskott, med ett löfte om ytterligare 250 gp om de får bevis för att Kruuk säljer magiska föremål och ytterligare 250 gp för varje magiskt föremål som hämtas från hans bageri.

entries.name: Kruuk Makes a Deal
entries: Även om han utåt sett verkar vara en vänlig, äldre bagare, driver Old Man Kruuk en effektiv verksamhet som hälare för stöldgods (se "{@area Old Man Kruuk's|1b6|x}" tidigare i kapitlet). Hans bedrifter har gett honom kontakter inte bara med småtjuvar utan även med professionella legosoldater och trollkarlar på den svarta marknaden.

entries.name: River District Canal Map
entries: På kartan över floddistriktskanalen finns följande platser:

items.name: Q1: Old Man Kruuk's.
items.entry: Denna anläggning beskrivs i avsnittet "Bakery by the Canal" nedan.

items.name: Q2: Trees.
items.entry: Flera jättelika cederträd växer i detta område.

items.name: Q3: Canal.
items.entry: Denna 5 fot djupa och 20 fot breda kanal är en av många sådana vattendrag i River District. Kanalerna har rep eller broar över sig för att underlätta för fotgängare att färdas genom distriktet.

entries.name: Bakery by the Canal
entries: När karaktärerna anländer till gamle Kruuks bageri strax efter solnedgången ska du läsa eller parafrasera följande:

När du närmar dig byggnaden hör du det mjuka ljudet av vatten som skvalpar mot kanalens stränder. Dofter av honung och rosor blandas med doften av nyklippt gräs. "Old Man Kruuk's" står det med stora bokstäver ovanför dörren, och på en skylt som hänger på dörrhandtaget står det: "Tyvärr, vi har stängt! Vi ses i morgon bitti!"

Genom att inspektera byggnadens framsida och göra en lyckad DC 16 Wisdom ({@skill Perception})-kontroll kan en karaktär se att skylten som hänger på dörrhandtaget är omgiven av ett fält av färgade prickar. Punkterna verkar oregelbundet placerade för ett otränat öga, men en karaktär som kan tjuvkantskapen känner igen mönstret som en del av en kod, vilket identifierar denna plats som ett förvaringsställe för stöldgods. Tecknet i sig är dock inte tillräckligt för att bevisa att Kruuk handlar med olagliga magiska föremål.

entries.name: Q1a: Bakery Shop
entries: Ytterdörren är olåst och en liten silverklocka på dörren jinglar när den öppnas. Osålda föremål sitter fortfarande i sina vitriner. Old Man Kruuk, en neutral, halvorc {@creature bandit captain}, sitter bakom disken och räknar dagens intäkter.

Klockan vid ingången förstör alla möjligheter för karaktärerna att komma in obemärkt. Medan några karaktärer håller Kruuk upptagen kan en annan karaktär smyga iväg genom att göra en lyckad DC 13 Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) kontroll.
Om karaktärerna försöker få Kruuk att prata svarar han att bageriet är stängt men erbjuder sig att sälja några överblivna tårtor eller rullar till dem innan de åker.

En karaktär som talar till Kruuk på tjuvspråk eller lyckas med en DC 15 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) kontroll vinner hans förtroende, varpå han avslöjar att han nyligen har fått ett "magiskt kort svärd" och att han planerar att sälja det senare ikväll (se "{@area A Deal Goes Down|256|x}" nedan). Om karaktärerna uttrycker intresse för att köpa vapnet ber Kruuk dem att vänta tills hans köpare anländer, varefter han kommer att sälja svärdet till högstbjudande. Om en karaktär misslyckas med testet säger Kruuk ingenting om det magiska kortsvärdet eller hans illegala affärsverksamhet.

entries.name: Q1b: Bakery
entries: Kruuks bageri är smutsigt, med soptunnor fyllda med möglig deg och gamla plattbröd. Bakom ett bord på den norra väggen finns en hemlig dörr som leder till hans bakre rum (område Q1e). En karaktär som undersöker väggen och lyckas med en DC 10 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation})-kontroll hittar den dolda dörren, som kan öppnas genom att trycka på den.

entries.name: Q1c: Bedroom
entries: I Kruuks sovrum finns ett skrivbord och en stol, en madrass på golvet, hyllor med personliga tillhörigheter och ett par 25-pundshantlar. På den norra väggen hänger en helkroppsmålning av en lättklädd tiefling. Målningen döljer en dörr till hans bakre rum (område Q1e).

entries.name: Q1d: Courtyard
entries: I mitten av Kruuks egendom finns en gräsbevuxen innergård. Den har trädörrar som leder till alla fyra rum som omger den. Dessa dörrar är låsta, men alla dörrar kan öppnas med hjälp av en nyckel som Kruuk har på sig. Ett lås kan plockas upp av en karaktär som gör en lyckad DC 16 Dexterity-kontroll med hjälp av {@item thieves' tools|PHB}. En dörr kan brytas upp av en karaktär som gör en framgångsrik DC 11 styrka ({@skill Athletics}) kontroll.

entries.name: Q1e: Back Room
entries: Ytterdörren på den västra väggen är låst. Låset kan öppnas av en karaktär som gör en lyckad DC 15 Dexterity check med hjälp av {@item thieves' tools|PHB}. Dörren kan brytas upp av en karaktär som lyckas med en DC 11 Strength ({@skill Athletics})-kontroll, men ljudet alarmerar alla i byggnaden.

Rummet luktar förruttnelse, och järnhandbojor är fastskruvade på väggen. Det finns fläckar av olika slag på golvet. I rummet finns vattenkannor, lösa smycken och lådor som innehåller stöldgods av lågt värde.

En karaktär som lyckas med DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) hittar en metalllåda som är gömd under en uppochnedvänd låda i ett hörn av rummet. Låsboxen kan öppnas av en karaktär som gör en lyckad DC 21 Dexterity-kontroll med hjälp av {@item thieves' tools|PHB}. Den kan också öppnas med en lyckad DC 16 styrka ({@skill Athletics}) kontroll. Om lådan öppnas med våld sprutar giftgas utåt, och karaktären som öppnade den måste lyckas med ett DC 15 Konstitutions räddningskast eller ta 22 ({@dice 4d10}) giftskador och vara {@condition poisoned} i 1 timme.

Låsboxen innehåller den {@item ruidium shortsword|CRCotN} som Kruuk planerar att sälja (se "En affär går igenom" nedan). Om karaktärerna har vunnit Kruuks förtroende öppnar han låslådan för att visa dem svärdet och förklarar sedan dess magiska egenskaper (se {@adventure appendix B|CRCotN|9|{@item Ruidium Weapon|CRCotN}}).

entries.name: A Deal Goes Down
entries: Kruuk planerar att träffa en timme efter solnedgången med {@creature Ashann|CRCotN}, en kaotisk neutral gnom {@creature occult extollant|CRCotN} (se {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}) som arbetar för Consortium of the Vermilion Dream. {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} bär på en påse som innehåller fem peridoter (500 gp styck).

entries.title: {@creature Ashann|CRCotN}

entries: Vid utsatt tid kommer {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} till Kruuks bageri. Om karaktärerna inte har neutraliserat honom leder Kruuk {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} till det bakre rummet (område Q1e) så att hon kan undersöka {@item ruidium shortsword|CRCotN}. Om han har mer än en potentiell köpare håller Kruuk en improviserad auktion i bakre rummet och startar budgivningen på 1 000 gp. {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} har inte råd att betala mer än 2 500 gp för kortsvärdet, och hon attackerar alla som bjuder över den summan. {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} kapitulerar om hon reduceras till 10 träffpunkter eller mindre.

Om {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} har tagits bort ur ekvationen kan en karaktär övertyga Kruuk att sälja kortsvärdet för 500 gp genom att lyckas med en DC 14 Charisma ({@skill Intimidation} eller {@skill Persuasion}) kontroll, antingen genom att hota honom till livet eller genom att övertyga honom om att karaktärerna är intresserade av att bli återkommande kunder.

entries.name: Urban Chase
entries: Karaktärerna kan vänta med att ta {@item ruidium shortsword|CRCotN} från {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} efter att hon har gjort upp med Kruuk, i vilket fall {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} försöker fly med svärdet istället för att slåss, vilket resulterar i en jakt (använd {@book chase rules|DMG|8|Chases} och {@table Urban Chase Complications} tabellen i {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}). Om {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} blir fångad kämpar hon för att behålla {@item ruidium shortsword|CRCotN} men överlämnar det om hon reduceras till 10 träffpunkter eller färre.

entries.name: Returning to the Temple
entries: Iwo är glad över att ta emot {@item ruidium shortsword|CRCotN} och överlämnar den överenskomna belöningen i utbyte mot den. Iwo är noga med att inte röra vapnet med bar hand. (Efter att ha undersökt svärdet noggrant i några dagar förstör Kobolt själens munkar det för att se till att det inte korrumperar någon). Om karaktärerna verkar ovilliga att avstå från svärdet, varnar Iwo dem för att vapnet kan vara farligt för dess bärare. Om det är nödvändigt höjer Iwo belöningen till 1 000 gp, i hopp om att det extra myntet ska övertyga karaktärerna om att dela med sig av vapnet.
Om karaktärerna har Kruuk, {@creature Ashann|CRCotN} eller båda i sitt förvar, låter Iwo brottslingarna hållas fängslade tills Ord-handarna kan tillkallas för att föra bort dem.

entries.name: Joining the Cobalt Soul
entries: Sju dagar efter det att karaktärerna har slutfört uppdraget anser Cobalt Soul-arkivarien att de är värdiga och motiverade nog att gå med i organisationen som fullvärdiga medlemmar. Karaktärerna får ett kort gratulationsmeddelande från Iwo via {@item Sending Stones||sending stone}. Medlemskapet kommer med följande fördelar:

items: Varje ny medlem får en klosterkåpa som liknar den som bärs av andra medlemmar av Cobalt Soul. Om kavajen förloras eller skadas kan en ersättningsrock köpas i Mentorns tempel för 1 gp.
Varje ny medlem får gratis logi i Ank'Harel så länge medlemskapet varar. Boendet är av bekväm kvalitet (se "{@area Lodging|191|x}" tidigare i kapitlet).

Nya medlemmar kan köpa följande magiska föremål i mentorns tempel: en {@item spell scroll} av {@spell detect magic} (10 gp), en {@item spell scroll} av {@spell divination} (125 gp), en {@item spell scroll} av {@spell commune} (250 gp) och ett par {@item sending stones} (250 gp).

entries: Karaktärerna kan inte ta emot fler uppdrag från Cobalt Soul om de inte blir medlemmar i fraktionen.

entries.name: Cobalt Soul Mission 3: Elephant Uproar
entries: Efter att Cobalt Soul fått rapporter om märkliga händelser i Suncut Bazaar, antar High Curator {@creature Jamil A'alithiya|CRCotN} att konsortiet Vermilion Dream måste göra framsteg i sin forskning om det karmosinröda ämnet ruidium. Jamil är orolig för de potentiellt destruktiva återverkningarna om konsortiet lär sig att använda det och skickar karaktärerna att infiltrera konsortiets högkvarter.

entries.name: Getting the Mission
entries: Nästa gång karaktärerna besöker Mentorns tempel informerar Iwo dem om att den höga kuratorn vill tala med dem. Den höga kuratorns kontor ligger på tredje våningen. När karaktärerna går in i det läser du:
Vid det breda bordet sitter en ung man, inte äldre än trettio år, med brun hud och hasselblå ögon. Hans vita kläder är prydda med blå mönster.
Han ler varmt när du kommer in. "Snälla, stäng dörren bakom dig", säger han och stänger boken framför sig. "Jag är högkurator {@creature Jamil A'alithiya|CRCotN} och jag har hört mycket om dig.

"Vi vet att konsortiet Vermilion Dream experimenterar med en röd substans som dess ledare kallar ruidium. Ryktet säger att ämnet kommer från ruinerna av Cael Morrow, undervattensstaden under Ank'Harel.

"Jag är orolig för att konsortiet manipulerar med krafter som ligger utanför dess kontroll. Därför vill jag att du infiltrerar konsortiets högkvarter - en taverna som heter First Eclipse - och tar reda på allt du kan om dess forskning på ruidium. Om du råkar stöta på några magiska föremål i konsortiets ägo, var snäll och konfiskera dem och ta dem till vårt tempel för undersökning och förvaring."

{@creature Jamil A'alithiya|CRCotN}, en neutral god, mänsklig {@creature monastic high curator|CRCotN} (se {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}), erbjuder en belöning på 1000 gp för att slutföra uppdraget.

Även om han misstänker att konsortiet Vermilion Dream har börjat tillverka ruidiumvapen och rustningar, håller Jamil denna information för sig själv för tillfället. Han hoppas att karaktärerna antingen kommer att bekräfta eller avfärda hans misstankar.

entries.name: A Bazaar Encounter
entries: När karaktärerna anländer till Suncut Bazaar, läs:

The sound of wood splintering and cries of panic echo through the streets, then are suddenly drowned out by a trumpeting roar that heralds the arrival of two red, crystalline elephants. One smashes through a stall as the other strides a few paces behind its companion.

This combat encounter takes place on the {@adventure Streets of the Suncut Bazaar map|CRCotN|4|Streets of the Suncut Bazaar}. The crystalline creatures are two {@creature Ruidium Elephant|CRCotN|ruidium elephants} (see their stat block earlier in the adventure). These elephants are running amok and must be destroyed before they cause any further damage.

The first elephant that drops to 0 hit points turns into a tiny marble elephant {@item Figurine of Wondrous Power, Marble Elephant||figurine of wondrous power} with thin veins of ruidium running through it.

The second elephant crumbles into ruidium dust when reduced to 0 hit points. A character who makes a successful DC 17 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check determines that this elephant was created using magic, with a small amount of ruidium as a material component; in other words, it was never a magic item to begin with.

Once the elephants have been dispatched, the characters can follow the elephants' trail of destruction back to First Eclipse. The characters are familiar with this tavern if they've had dealings with the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream.

entries.name: Keeping the Figurine
entries: Karaktärerna kan behålla elefantfiguren, men de gör klokt i att inte använda den, eftersom elefanten som den skapar använder {@creature ruidium elephant|CRCotN} stat-blocket (se tidigare i kapitlet) och inte kan kontrolleras.

Om karaktärerna dödar eller förlöser Apotheon (se {@area chapter 7|3d5|x}) blir figuren befriad från sin ruidiumförvanskning och fungerar som en normal {@item Figurine of Wondrous Power, Marble Elephant||figurine of wondrous power (marble elephant)}.

entries.name: First Eclipse
entries: The elephants were released by Khelkur the Gull, a neutral evil, dwarf {@creature occult silvertongue|CRCotN} who's one of the masters of the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream. He and the bartender, Satzrak Runestrider, a neutral evil, blue dragonborn {@creature occult extollant|CRCotN} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8} for both stat blocks), are in First Eclipse's taproom, celebrating the success of their experiment. The tavern is otherwise empty.
When the characters enter, Satzrak barks, "We're closed!" and expects the characters to leave at once. If they don't, Khelkur says, "Leave now, or meet your doom!"
Unless the characters leave immediately, Khelkur and Satzrak attack.
After the battle, any character who searches Khelkur finds a crumpled note stuffed in one of his pockets. This note, written by one of his colleagues, bears the following message in Common:
Master Khelkur,

Our attempts to gain access to the rift have been disastrous. An aboleth haunts the Drowned City. It slaughtered all but one member of our last expedition. The creature calls itself Alyxian—certainly not an aboleth name, but not one I am familiar with either. But know this: Cael Morrow is where we must focus our efforts, lest the Allegiance of Allsight claim the only known source of ruidium for itself.

Our key to the rift is lost, but we have a spy in the Drowned City searching for it. Meanwhile, we have decided to secure a new headquarters. Please see that First Eclipse is cleared out—and quickly—before the Hands of Ord search the place.
Humbly, Master Dendarron

Characters who search First Eclipse find no magic items or other treasure. Consortium agents under Khelkur's command have already emptied the tavern of valuables and moved the faction's headquarters to a new location.

entries.name: Returning to the Temple
entries: Jamil welcomes the characters back to the Temple of the Mentor at the end of the mission. If they turn over Dendarron's note, the elephant figurine, or both, he gives them the promised reward of 1,000 gp.

The handwritten note from Master Dendarron (whom Jamil recognizes as one of the leaders of the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream) makes it clear that the Consortium is keen to secure more ruidium, which is accessible only through a rift in Cael Morrow. Jamil informs the characters that he will contact allies in the Allegiance of Allsight and arrange safe passage for the characters into the Drowned City. Until they hear from him, the characters can do as they please.

entries.name: Cobalt Soul Mission 4: Allegiance Alliance
entries: Seven days after they complete the previous mission, the characters are invited to the Temple of the Mentor to meet with High Curator {@creature Jamil A'alithiya|CRCotN}, who plans to send them on a mission in the Drowned City.

entries.name: Getting the Mission
entries: Read or paraphrase the following when the characters arrive at Jamil's study:
As you enter his study, the high curator spreads his arms wide and softly says, "Welcome. I am glad to see you again.

"The Allegiance of Allsight has granted you access to Cael Morrow. The Allegiance's control of the excavation site is threatened by the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream, so it's important that we act quickly.

"Ruidium is a magical substance that corrupts everything it touches. It comes from a place called the Netherdeep, which can be reached by passing through a rift in the heart of Cael Morrow. I've been told that passage through the rift requires some sort of key, but I don't know what form the key takes.

"I fear further unrest in Ank'Harel so long as the rift exists. The Netherdeep must be sealed off or destroyed, lest ruidium continue to find its way into Ank'Harel. But first thing's first. We need that key."

Jamil believes that the Allegiance of Allsight and the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream are acting selfishly by taking advantage of their access to the Netherdeep. He asks the characters to accomplish the following tasks and report back before seven days have elapsed:

items: Enter Cael Morrow and rendezvous with Professor {@creature Insight Acuere|CRCotN} at the Allegiance of Allsight base camp.
Earn {@skill Insight}'s trust and learn how to access the Netherdeep.
Acquire the "key" to the Netherdeep.

entries: Jamil promises the characters a reward of 1,000 gp if they find a key to the Netherdeep.

At the end of the meeting, Jamil gives each character an Allegiance of Allsight badge on loan from that organization. These badges will allow them to enter Cael Morrow and move around freely within the excavation site.

entries.name: Insight's Quest
entries: The characters can meet {@skill Insight} in the Allegiance base camp ({@area area M3|28b|x} in {@adventure chapter 5|CRCotN|5}). She tells them that her companions are searching for the writings of an ancient hero who tried to save Cael Morrow from destruction during the Calamity. Earlier expeditions found dozens of stone tablets from the period in question at the south end of the excavation site. Her team, however, no longer has the force of arms to fight the dangerous creatures that lurk in this region. If the characters can find more of these tablets and return them to her, she'll be grateful.

entries.name: Insight's Reward
entries: If the characters bring back the tablet from {@area area M10|2b5|x} in {@adventure chapter 5|CRCotN|5}, {@skill Insight} shares the following information:

items: {@skill Insight} reveals the location of the rift leading to the Netherdeep ({@area area M17|2ce|x} in {@adventure chapter 5|CRCotN|5}) and informs the characters that weapons infused with ruidium can open this rift.
{@skill Insight} believes there might be keys to the rift in Cael Morrow—left behind by agents of the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: Det här uppdraget utspelar sig främst i Cael Morrow. Viktiga platser som karaktärerna måste besöka är följande:

items.name: Maw of Cael Morrow.
items.entry: Den här platsen är huvudingången till Drowned City (se avsnittet "{@area Maw of Cael Morrow|1be|x}" tidigare i kapitlet).

entries.name: Allegiance Base Camp ({@area Chapter 5, Area M3|28b|x})
entries: This location is the heart of Allegiance operations in Cael Morrow.

entries.name: Unstable Building ({@area Chapter 5, Area M10|2b5|x})
entries: This location contains the tablet that {@skill Insight} seeks.

entries.name: Cliffside Villa ({@area Chapter 5, Area M13|2be|x})
entries: The "key" to enter the Netherdeep can be any {@item ruidium weapon|CRCotN}. Such an item can be found in this sunken villa.

entries.name: Returning to the Temple
entries: If the characters complete the mission and return to Jamil, he gives them the 1,000 gp reward and requests that they await another summons in seven days' time.

entries.name: Cobalt Soul Mission 5: Enemy of Our Enemies
entries: Seven days after the characters complete the previous mission, Jamil requests another meeting with them, during which he imparts the following information:

items: Tensions between the Allegiance of Allsight and the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream have grown in the past seven days.
The rift to the Netherdeep is guarded by an aboleth that believes it is the Apotheon of legend, defending its realm against invaders.
The Apotheon is said to have died in Cael Morrow at the end of the Calamity. Perhaps the aboleth is, indeed, some bizarre manifestation of this fallen hero.

entries: Jamil needs the characters to accomplish one of the following tasks and report back within three days:

items: If the aboleth is truly Alyxian, it might listen to reason. The characters must inform the aboleth that they are not enemies of the Apotheon and convince it to allow them to enter the rift.
If the first task can't be accomplished, the characters must slay the aboleth so they have easier access to the Netherdeep when the time comes.

entries: Jamil's reward for this task is 1,000 gp. He promises he will continue researching the Netherdeep in hopes that he can help them make their eventual journey into it.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: Det här uppdraget utspelar sig främst i Cael Morrow. Viktiga platser som karaktärerna måste besöka är följande:

items.name: Maw of Cael Morrow.
items.entry: Den här platsen är huvudingången till Drowned City (se avsnittet "{@area Maw of Cael Morrow|1be|x}" tidigare i kapitlet).

entries.name: Temple of the Arch Heart ({@area Chapter 5, Area M9|2ad|x})
entries: This location is Alyxian's final prayer site. Accessing it is necessary to unlock the full power of the {@item Jewel of Three Prayers|CRCotN}.

entries.name: Kelp Forest ({@area Chapter 5, Area M11|2b9|x})
entries: The Alyxian Aboleth lairs here, though the characters might encounter the creature elsewhere.

entries.name: Rift to the Netherdeep ({@area Chapter 5, Area M17|2ce|x})
entries: Denna planariska spricka förbinder Netherdeep med det materiella planet.

entries.name: Negotiating with the Aboleth
entries: The {@creature Alyxian Aboleth|CRCotN} attacks the characters on sight. As an action, a character claiming to be Alyxian's friend or ally can try to persuade the aboleth to leave the party alone, doing so with a successful DC 25 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check, or DC 15 if that character presents the {@item Jewel of Three Prayers|CRCotN}.

If the check fails, the aboleth rails against the characters, bellowing, "I am Alyxian! I am the Apotheon! I am divine, I am invincible! I am beyond mortal ken!" The delusional monster attacks its foes ruthlessly.

If the check succeeds, the aboleth gurgles contentedly and says, "Then, my friends, I will join your fight and defeat our shared enemies, just as I did so long ago." The aboleth no longer attacks the characters and, if they request it, harries their rivals and any other adversaries they identify.

entries.name: Cobalt Soul Mission 6: Destroy the Netherdeep
entries: The final mission in the Cobalt Soul Story Track requires the characters to enter the Netherdeep and try to destroy it from the inside.
Seven days after they return from the previous mission, the characters receive their next mission from Jamil, who imparts the following information:

items: Both the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream and the Allegiance of Allsight are trying to stockpile ruidium. If the flow of ruidium out of the Netherdeep isn't cut off immediately, the consequences could be disastrous.
The Consortium has sent a group of skilled adventurers into the Netherdeep. (This group is the rival party.)

To survive the underwater pressure of the Netherdeep, one needs an item at least partially made of ruidium. (The {@item Jewel of Three Prayers|CRCotN} also allows its wearer to withstand the pressure.)

entries: Jamil requests that the characters find a way to destroy the Netherdeep and report back to him before fourteen days have elapsed. Jamil says he can think of no reward appropriate for accomplishing a task of this magnitude, but he offers the characters 2,000 gp each and hopes that will suffice.

entries.name: Success
entries: This mission can succeed only if the characters slay or redeem Alyxian, thus destroying the Netherdeep and all ruidium in the process (see {@area chapter 7|3d5|x} for details).

data.name: Chapter 5: The Drowned City
entries: Cael Morrow lies in a flooded cavern deep beneath the foundations of Ank'Harel. Only ruins of the place remain, but even so there is no doubt that Cael Morrow was one of the most magnificent cities in the world before the Calamity. (The city's original name is unknown; "Cael Morrow" is the name given to the place by the archaeologists of the Allegiance of Allsight.) In those days, it was home to elves of all kinds—including those who were transformed into Exandria's first orcs by the blood of Gruumsh the Ruiner after Corellon pierced his eye on the field of battle. The city was a bastion of hope, its magical wards blessed by the Arch Heart.

Infuriated by his loss to Corellon, Gruumsh swore to annihilate Cael Morrow. The Betrayer stood more than a hundred feet tall, looming over a temple to Corellon in the center of the city. There, he raised his terrible spear, intending to strike the earth with such force that all of Marquet would be reduced to ash—only to have his blow parried by Alyxian the Apotheon at the last second.

Cael Morrow, the Drowned City, is the grave of thousands of Gruumsh's victims. Even Alyxian's sacrifice, which protected much of the land of Marquet at the cost of his freedom, could not save the city. Now, the center of Cael Morrow is a planar rift born from the place where Gruumsh's spear struck the earth. This rift is the gateway to the Netherdeep, the fountainhead of the corrupting element ruidium, and an object of fascination to Ank'Harel's factions. The rift will draw the characters and their rivals into conflict once more—with the chance to become heroes.

entries.title: An aboleth mutated by ruidium haunts the dark waters of Cael Morrow

entries.name: Running This Chapter
entries: This chapter contains a description of the ruins of Cael Morrow, which the characters explore over the course of the various faction missions detailed in the previous chapter. These missions, which differ depending on which faction the characters have allied themselves with, form the story of this chapter. The missions aren't necessary for advancing the adventure plot; if the characters want to save Alyxian and enter the Netherdeep, they can do so without the prompting of their faction. But if they need a push to enter the Netherdeep, the missions in {@adventure chapter 4|CRCotN|4} can help motivate them.

entries.name: Rival Developments
entries: Like the characters, the rivals entered Cael Morrow on behalf of their faction. But the treacherous ruins and horrific creatures have taken their toll on the group.

When the characters encounter their rivals in Cael Morrow, it might be the first time they've met since Bazzoxan. In the meantime, the rivals have been working with an opposing faction, exploring Cael Morrow and the Netherdeep in their own way—and facing the eerie beings within.

By the time the characters meet them again in Cael Morrow, the rivals have changed dramatically. They now use their tier 3 stat blocks (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}). The changes the rivals have undergone are as follows:

{@creature Ayo Jabe (Tier 3)|CRCotN|Ayo Jabe}. Ayo's drive to prove herself a hero, and to prove herself superior to the characters, has brought her to this place. She is aware of the trauma that her quest has put her friends through. This feeling has led her to doubt her leadership abilities. Ayo is filled with cold fury toward anything that stands in her way, including her own insecurities.

{@creature Dermot Wurder (Tier 3)|CRCotN|Dermot Wurder}. Dermot's desire to protect his friends is still at the core of his being. But dozens of battles and near-death experiences have turned his uncertainty into steely confidence.

{@creature Galsariad Ardyth (Tier 3)|CRCotN|Galsariad Ardyth}. Galsariad's haughtiness has drained from his heart—as have all his other emotions. He has witnessed unspeakable horrors in the name of gaining greater magical power and has protected himself from being overcome by fear and self-loathing by suppressing all his feelings.

{@creature Irvan Wastewalker (Tier 3)|CRCotN|Irvan Wastewalker}. Irvan's cavalier demeanor disappeared when he lost his arm in a battle with a slithering bloodfin in Cael Morrow. His faction allies fitted him with a stylish and functional arcane prosthetic, but this brush with death has made him short-tempered, cautious, and mistrustful. Irvan fears that any further mistake could cost him his life—permanently.

{@creature Maggie Keeneyes (Tier 3)|CRCotN|Maggie Keeneyes}. A deep melancholy has taken root in Maggie's heart. She continues the mission out of love for Ayo, but she fears that her leader's determination might not be enough to achieve victory. Maggie doesn't trust the Allegiance of Allsight agents in Cael Morrow (even if the rivals have allied with that faction), believing them to be influenced by a malevolent force. She has shared her misgivings about this organization with Ayo on several occasions.

entries.name: Encountering the Rivals
entries: The rivals have become affiliated with a faction of your choice, most likely the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream. Their reason for joining their faction and coming into conflict with the characters depends on how the characters have interacted with them so far:

items.name: Friendly Rivals.
items.entry: Rivals who are friendly toward the characters are happy for the groups to work together.

items.name: Indifferent Rivals.
items.entry: If the rivals are indifferent to the characters, then this competition is nothing personal—it's just business, and they happen to be on different sides. If they are working for the same faction, the rivals are willing to cooperate, but they make it clear they intend to come out on top and be considered the real heroes.

items.name: Hostile Rivals.
items.entry: Rivals who are hostile toward the characters hold a grudge against them and aim to prove their superiority.

entries: A good time for the characters to encounter the rivals is when the characters try to leave Cael Morrow with something valuable in their possession, such as the Key to the Netherdeep (see the faction story tracks in {@adventure chapter 4|CRCotN|4}) or the {@item Jewel of Three Prayers|CRCotN} in its {@item Jewel of Three Prayers (Exalted)|CRCotN|Exalted State} (see {@area area M9|2ad|x}).

If the characters get the better of the rivals in this chapter, you can use the rivals' defeat to change the pace of the exploration of the Netherdeep in the next chapter. The rivals could take a few days to lick their wounds and prepare for the next encounter with the characters. Or the rivals' defeat could reenergize them, prompting them to try to get a head start on exploring the Netherdeep.

entries.name: Allegiance of Allsight Badges
entries: Cael Morrow is currently under the jurisdiction of the Allegiance of Allsight, whose members wear badges inside their robes. (For more information on these badges and how the characters can obtain them, see {@adventure chapter 4|CRCotN|4}.) Interlopers who don't show their official badge when asked are attacked on sight. Allegiance agents try to apprehend intruders by knocking them {@condition unconscious} and then take them to Professor {@creature Insight Acuere|CRCotN} (see {@area area M3|28b|x}) for questioning.

entries.name: Cael Morrow Overview
entries: Rare are the things that remain beautiful after their deaths—Cael Morrow is one of them. Through the efforts of the Allegiance of Allsight, portions of the sunken city have been reclaimed and magically warded against the pervasive deluge. In the last few months, the faction has done its best to reinforce the city's eroding architecture, securing the place for the sake of the faction's archaeological pursuits.

Despite these efforts, though, Cael Morrow remains a largely inhospitable place. Otherworldly aquatic creatures thrive in the ruins, some adapted to and warped by the impenetrable darkness and others aberrant growths spawned in the Netherdeep. To make matters worse, the spirits of the dead and the damned from the Calamity long ago still haunt the wreckage of the city.

entries.name: Features of Cael Morrow
entries: The areas of the Drowned City, depicted on the map of Cael Morrow, have the features described below.

entries.name: Architecture
entries: Unless otherwise noted, the areas in Cael Morrow have 30-foot-high ceilings, and the ceilings in the connecting hallways are 20 feet high. Doorways are 8 feet high and 3 feet wide.

entries.name: Flooded Cavern
entries: The cavern that contains the sunken city is 500 feet below ground and filled with fresh water that flows out of the Netherdeep rift ({@area area M17|2ce|x}). The water bubbles up to Ank'Harel through a narrow, natural channel in the roof of the cavern (not shown on the map).
The characters first enter the flooded cavern by descending the hollow interior of a natural stone column ({@area area M1|285|x}) that stretches from the top of the cavern to the bottom.

entries.name: Light
entries: Unless otherwise noted, all keyed locations on the map are lit by {@spell continual flame} spells. The only areas not illuminated in this way are places where the Allegiance of Allsight hasn't yet erected protective wards (described below).

entries.name: Magical Barriers and Keystones
entries: The Allegiance of Allsight has constructed 1-inch-thick magical barriers of shimmering, light blue force around certain areas of Cael Morrow, as indicated on the map. These wards have forced the water out of those areas, leaving behind dry, air-filled chambers and hallways. The rest of the Drowned City is underwater.

The barriers are soundproof, and their edges overlap with walls, doors, ceilings, and floors without harming those features. In places where a barrier overlaps with a stone wall, door, ceiling, or floor, it is {@condition invisible} and untouchable.
Any ward that encloses an area also creates a barrier across the doorways leading to and from that area. These barriers function as airlocks.

A barrier is immune to all damage, is impermeable to liquids, and can't be dispelled. A creature can pass through a barrier, in either direction, by spending 5 feet of movement, but no creature can be pushed or pulled through by another one. As a creature passes through a barrier, it experiences a harmless tingling sensation.

Each warded area has a keystone located somewhere in it. For example, a keystone might be inserted into the top of a door frame or set into the floor. A keystone is a cube of solid gray stone measuring 6 inches on a side, each side inscribed with arcane runes that emit the same blue light as the barriers. A keystone has AC 17, 50 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Destroying an area's keystone, removing a keystone from the area it affects, or targeting a keystone with a {@spell dispel magic} spell causes the barrier around that area to dissipate. If that happens, each creature in the area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@dice 6d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one, as the area fills with water.

entries.name: The Alyxian Aboleth
entries: Lurking in the waters of Cael Morrow is an aboleth that believes it is the physical embodiment of the Apotheon. It uses the {@creature Alyxian Aboleth|CRCotN} stat block in {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}.

entries.name: Where Is the Aboleth?
entries: The aboleth's lair is in Cael Morrow's kelp forest ({@area area M11|2b9|x}). The creature routinely swims about in the ruins, striking fear into those who are delving into the remains of the city. If the Alyxian Aboleth is reduced to half its hit points or fewer, it retreats to its lair and tries to take an uninterrupted short rest, regaining {@dice 9d10 + 36} hit points at the end of it.

To determine the aboleth's whereabouts while the characters explore Cael Morrow, roll a {@dice d20} and consult the Aboleth's Location table, or choose one of the suggested locations. The aboleth has free access to all the submerged map locations. It's recommended that you determine a new location for the aboleth whenever the characters move from one area to another, though the creature can move less frequently if you see fit.

entries.caption: Aboleth's Location
rows: Brooding in its lair in {@area area M11|2b9|x}
Searching {@area area M8|2a7|x} for archaeologists to devour
Patrolling the rift in {@area area M17|2ce|x}

entries.name: Poisoned Emotions
entries: The aboleth's psychic powers have been amplified by the ruidium that pervades its flesh.

The first time the characters enter each of several keyed locations (areas {@area M2|288|x}, {@area M4|293|x}, {@area M5a|299|x}, {@area M7c|2a6|x}, {@area M8|2a7|x}, {@area M10|2b5|x}, and {@area M15|2c6|x}), the aboleth transmits a telepathic message to one randomly determined character, who hears the aboleth's voice—a distorted version of the true voice of Alyxian that they've heard in their visions—echo in their mind. Roll on the Poisoned Emotions table to determine the aboleth's message. After receiving the message, the character must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or suffer the message's corresponding effect, as noted in the table. A character can repeat the saving throw after finishing a short or long rest, ending the effect on themself on a success. The effect can also be removed from a character by any magic that ends a curse.

The aboleth loses this ability when the consciousness of the Apotheon manifests in the Temple of Corellon (see "Second Vision" in {@area area M9|2ad|x}), and any creatures currently affected by it feel its effects end immediately.

entries.caption: Poisoned Emotions
rows: "Ungrateful wretches—they have forgotten all I have done!"
The character has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws.
"My power was not enough. It never will be."
The character has disadvantage on attack rolls.
The character has disadvantage on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws.
"They were right. I bring nothing but despair."
The character has disadvantage on Charisma checks and Charisma saving throws.
"If I can't live, I will burn this world with me."
Whenever the character hits a creature with a weapon attack, the target takes an extra {@dice 1d6} psychic damage, and the character also takes {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.

entries.name: Uncharted Waters
entries: Many areas of Cael Morrow have yet to be secured by the Allegiance of Allsight. Exploring areas unprotected by magical wards is a dangerous proposition, with hungry sea creatures liable to be lurking around any corner. When the characters enter an area of Cael Morrow not protected by a ward, roll on the Cael Morrow Encounters table to determine what they face. Don't roll on this table if hostile creatures are already in the area.
Cael Morrow includes many other areas beyond what this book describes. You can use the encounters from this table to populate other parts of the sunken city for the party to explore.

entries.caption: Cael Morrow Encounters
rows: A {@creature swarm of sorrowfish|CRCotN} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}) flocks around the detritus of a shark's corpse, ravenous for more prey.
Three {@creature Scuttling Serpentmaw|CRCotN|scuttling serpentmaws} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}) search for food.
A {@creature giant octopus} wrestles with a locked chest. The chest contains 1,000 ep in coins minted long ago in Cael Morrow.
Tentacles burst from the darkness as a {@creature death embrace|CRCotN} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}) notices the characters.
Two {@creature Slithering Bloodfin|CRCotN|slithering bloodfins} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}) streak through the water, eager for a meal.
Two {@creature aboleth spawn|CRCotN} (see their stat block later in the chapter) spot the characters and flee to alert the Alyxian Aboleth, which appears 1 minute later.

entries.name: Cael Morrow Locations (M1-M8)
entries: The locations described below are keyed to the Cael Morrow map. This map doesn't show the sunken city in its entirety, just the areas important to the adventure. You can expand Cael Morrow by adding locations and encounters of your own design.

entries.name: M1: Stone Column
entries: A 10-foot-wide spiral staircase descends along the interior of a hollow stone column that extends down from the Maw of Cael Morrow in Ank'Harel's Sigil District (described in {@area chapter 4|1be|x}).
Read or paraphrase the following when the characters reach the bottom of the column for the first time:

You descend a spiral staircase for hundreds of feet. Windows in the nearby wall offer glimpses of a sunken city below Ank'Harel. Magical lights illuminate several of its ruins, but most of the city is hidden from view.

At the bottom of the staircase is a plain, windowless room containing boxes of archaeological tools and crates marked with the emblem of the Allegiance of Allsight. Not far away is a passage that leads to a stone door also marked with the Allegiance's symbol. Leaning against the wall next to the door is an orc wearing the badge of an Allegiance of Allsight member. He doesn't seem to have noticed you.

The person near the door is a sullen, lawful neutral orc named Gortag Inkdrinker (use the {@creature scholarly agent|CRCotN} stat block in {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}). The characters can surprise him if they act quickly. If the characters are members of the Allegiance of Allsight or the Library of the Cobalt Soul, Gortag treats them as allies and invites them to meet with his superior, Professor {@skill Insight} Acuere, in the Allegiance base camp ({@area area M3|28b|x}). If the characters accept the invitation, he escorts them there.

If one or more characters aren't wearing Allegiance badges or claim to be in league with the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream, Gortag tells them to halt and return up the stairs and does his best to hinder their progress without provoking conflict. If combat breaks out, he opens the door he's guarding, pushes himself through the magical barrier that extends across the doorway (see "{@area Features of Cael Morrow|27b|x}" earlier in the chapter), and alerts the guards in area M2. If he's successful, he runs to area M3 to warn {@skill Insight} that enemies have entered the Drowned City. If Gortag is unable to flee, he throws himself on the characters' mercy and can be persuaded to lead the party past the guards in area M2, if only to avoid harm.

entries.name: Crates
entries: The crates contain recovered relics and specimens in glass jars, all packed for transport.

entries.name: M2: Warded Entrance Hall

entries: A corridor framed by shimmering blue light extends ahead of you. This airtight tunnel ends before a door set into the wall of a submerged building. Above the doorway is a small stone cube inscribed with glowing blue symbols. Standing in front of the door are two guards, a human and a halfling, wearing Allegiance of Allsight apparel and badges. Verdant patches of kelp grow just outside the tunnel's shimmering walls, and colorful fish flit between the swaying strands.

The first time the characters enter this area, one among them (determined randomly) receives a telepathic message from the Alyxian Aboleth (see "{@area Poisoned Emotions|282|x}" earlier in the chapter).
This hall is composed entirely of magical barriers created by the keystone placed above the doorway to area M3. See the "{@area Features of Cael Morrow|27f|x}" section for more information.

Two {@creature Scholarly Agent|CRCotN|scholarly agents} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}) stand outside the door to area M3. One is a lawful neutral human named Kal, and the other is a lawful good halfling named Nadiya.

These guards have dealt with raiders and infiltrators before. They are hostile to anyone who tries to get past them without a badge. If the characters are members of the Allegiance of Allsight or are accompanied by Gortag, the two guards let the group through with minimal questioning. If they believe the characters to be lying, the guards turn hostile and attack.

entries.name: Keystone
entries: The stone cube above the door to area M3 is a keystone (see "Features of Cael Morrow" earlier in the chapter). Destroying the keystone or removing it from this area causes the magical barriers that enclose area M2 to disappear. When that happens, all creatures in the corridor are engulfed by water. The barriers around area M3 remain intact.

entries.title: The Allegiance of Allsight maintains an underwater base camp, from where it coordinates archaeological excavations

entries.name: M3: Allegiance Base Camp

entries: This storage building has three floors connected by a spiral staircase. The archaeologists are using the shelf space to store journals, recovered relics, and excavation equipment. Windows warded by barriers of shimmering blue light offer views of the underwater cavern outside this structure.
Three individuals wearing Allegiance of Allsight garb and badges—a tiefling, a goliath, and a kenku—bustle about the space, engrossed in their work.

The Allegiance's base of operations in the ruins is maintained by an adjunct professor of archaeology named {@skill Insight} Acuere, a lawful good tiefling. Most of her team has been recalled to the Crystal Chateau, but she still has two research technicians helping her: the laconic {@creature Scribble|CRCotN}, a chaotic neutral kenku, and the rambunctious {@creature Xot|CRCotN}, a neutral good goliath (see the "{@area Goliaths of Exandria|1a4|x}" sidebar in {@adventure chapter 4|CRCotN|4}). See below for their statistics and roleplaying information.

Nearly inseparable, {@creature Scribble|CRCotN} and {@creature Xot|CRCotN} have been working together at the camp for months. They complement each other as friends and scholars. {@creature Xot|CRCotN} tends to talk ceaselessly about her latest discoveries, and {@creature Scribble|CRCotN} patiently listens, absorbing many of {@creature Xot|CRCotN}'s excited ramblings into his own speech.

If {@skill Insight}, {@creature Scribble|CRCotN}, and {@creature Xot|CRCotN} become hostile toward intruders, they fight to kill. On the first turn of combat, {@skill Insight} uses a {@item sending stone|AI} to contact Headmaster Cryon in the Crystal Chateau and request aid. Twenty minutes later, ten {@creature Scholarly Agent|CRCotN|scholarly agents} and five {@creature Scholarly Excavator|CRCotN|scholarly excavators} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8} for both stat blocks) arrive by way of area M1 to secure the base camp.

entries.title: Professor {@skill Insight} Acuere

entries.name: Insight Acuere
entries: The {@creature Insight Acuere|CRCotN|tiefling professor} uses the {@creature scholarly mastermind|CRCotN} stat block (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}), with these changes:

items: The professor speaks Aquan, Common, Infernal, and Orc.
She has resistance to fire damage and {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.

entries: {@skill Insight} won't cooperate with the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream unless she is tricked or magically compelled into doing so. If the characters are members of the Allegiance of Allsight, {@skill Insight} informs them that they have arrived earlier than she expected, but she's nonetheless happy to see them. If they're allied with the Cobalt Soul, she requires them to prove their usefulness before she reveals any information (see "{@area Insight's Quest|266|x}" in {@area mission 4|263|x} of the Cobalt Soul Story Track in {@adventure chapter 4|CRCotN|4}).

{@skill Insight} is the primary archivist for the Cael Morrow archaeological project and would put her life on the line to ensure its success. She is willing to share the results of her research with fellow Allegiance members. {@skill Insight} can offer the following information in response to the characters' questions:

items: The wards keeping the water at bay are magically generated by keystones in each warded location. These keystones look like small stone cubes with glowing runes carved into their sides. Removing a keystone from the area it protects causes the barriers around that location to vanish, allowing the water in.

The wards that have been erected end at an ancient temple to Corellon the Arch Heart, which seems to have its own magical way of holding back the water. Allegiance members have yet to breach the temple's ward.

A fourth member of the expedition, {@skill Insight}'s friend {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN}, a high elf professor of ancient literature, hasn't been seen in three days. {@skill Insight} is concerned but hasn't yet considered raising a search party because {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} has a shield guardian to protect her.

entries.name: Scribble
entries: {@creature Scribble|CRCotN} uses the {@creature scholarly agent|CRCotN} stat block (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}), with this change:

items: {@creature Scribble|CRCotN} understands Auran and Common but speaks only through mimicry. He can imitate any sounds he has heard, including voices.

entries: {@creature Scribble|CRCotN} seems pleasant enough, but a character who spends more than 10 minutes with him can tell that the kenku is haunted. While scouring Cael Morrow for relics, he received telepathic threats from the Alyxian Aboleth but lacks the vocabulary to convey the horror of that experience; however, he can repeat any of the phrases listed on the Poisoned Emotions table.

entries.name: Xot
entries: This goliath uses the {@creature scholarly excavator|CRCotN} stat block (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}), with these changes:

items: {@creature Xot|CRCotN} speaks Common and Giant.
She has resistance to cold damage and counts as one size larger when determining her carrying capacity and the weight she can push, drag, or lift.

entries: If the characters are members of the Allegiance of Allsight or if they succeed on a DC 14 Charisma ({@skill Deception} or {@skill Persuasion}) check, {@creature Xot|CRCotN} shows them the items she and {@creature Scribble|CRCotN} have stored on the second floor of the building. She explains that these objects were deemed too damaged or insignificant to warrant their transport topside, but she found them too charming to discard entirely.

{@creature Xot|CRCotN}'s collection consists of ancient baubles, rusted spear heads, and worthless bits of jewelry—but a character who makes a successful DC 12 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check finds a {@item ring of the ram} and a sludgy but still potent {@item Potion of Superior Healing||potion of healing (superior)}. {@creature Xot|CRCotN} can be convinced to give up these two items from her collection by a character who makes a successful DC 18 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check.

entries.name: Double Agent
entries: Characters who are following the {@area Allegiance Story Track|1cc|x} might come to Cael Morrow hoping to expose a double agent in the expedition. A character who speaks with {@skill Insight} Acuere, {@creature Scribble|CRCotN}, or {@creature Xot|CRCotN} can make a DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check to get a sense of that person's loyalty. On a successful check, it's apparent to the character that the individual is fully dedicated to the expedition and doesn't have any intention of betraying their faction.

entries.name: Exploring the Building
entries: The map of Cael Morrow shows only the first floor of area M3, but the upper two floors have a similar floor plan. The floors are described below.

items.name: First and Second Floors.
items.entry: These floors have shelves holding organic and mineral specimens taken from Cael Morrow. Characters interested in Exandrian history might find several clay tablets, sound-storing magic crystals, and water-damaged vellum manuscripts containing accounts and images of daily life in the city before the events of the Calamity that brought it to ruin. Tucked among the specimens is a selection of baubles that {@creature Xot|CRCotN} has hoarded.

items.name: Third Floor.
items.entry: Allegiance members come up here to rest. Large holes in the roof are covered by magical barriers of blue force, thanks to a keystone hidden on this floor (see "Keystone" below). This former attic holds six small crates of preserved food, a dozen casks of fresh water, six cots with soft pillows and blankets, and an unlocked wooden case containing two {@item Breathing Bubble|EGW|breathing bubbles} (see {@adventure appendix B|CRCotN|9|{@item Breathing Bubble|EGW}}) with full air supplies and three {@item Potion of Water Breathing||potions of water breathing}. {@skill Insight} and her companions won't permit the theft of these items, but {@skill Insight} is willing to share them with the characters if they request her aid and their goals align with hers.

entries.name: Keystone
entries: The keystone that keeps the water out of this building and the L-shaped corridor linking it to area M4 (see "{@area Features of Cael Morrow|27b|x}" earlier in the chapter) is hidden in a wall on the building's third floor behind a loose stone. {@skill Insight}, {@creature Scribble|CRCotN}, and {@creature Xot|CRCotN} know where the keystone is, but they won't divulge its location to others if doing so might endanger them or any other Allegiance members.

It takes 10 minutes for a character to thoroughly search the third floor. At the end of that time, the character can make a DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check, finding the keystone on a successful check. If the keystone is destroyed or removed from this area, water comes gushing in through the rooftop. In addition, the barriers that form the corridor to M4 disappear, engulfing the corridor's occupants in water.

entries.name: M4: Royal Guest House

entries: Before you are the ruins of a once-magnificent house of white stone. The ceiling has fallen through, leaving the marble floors littered with masonry, broken bed frames, and other furniture from at least three collapsed stories. A staircase leads from the entrance hall to the upper level of the main room. Walls of blue light hold back the water on all sides, leaving the interior dry.

The first time the characters enter this area, one among them (determined randomly) receives a telepathic message from the Alyxian Aboleth (see "{@area Poisoned Emotions|282|x}" earlier in the chapter).

Long ago this building was a guest house for royal visitors to Cael Morrow. Now it is an empty husk, mostly picked clean of valuables by the researchers of the Allegiance of Allsight. The keystone for the wards in this location (see "{@area Features of Cael Morrow|27b|x}" earlier in the chapter) is above the north door.

entries.name: M4a: Parlor
entries: This roofless chamber is filled with rubble from the collapsed upper floors and the staircase that once led up to them.

entries.name: M4b: Private Study
entries: This ruined study is filled with enormous chunks of fallen masonry.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Any character who spends 10 minutes searching through the rubble can make a DC 20 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. On a successful check, the character finds a {@item spell scroll} of {@spell teleport}. Only one such scroll can be found here.

entries.name: M5: Access Corridor
entries: This corridor of shimmering blue barriers intersects with the remains of a guard tower (area M5a), which is enclosed by barriers as well. The keystone that maintains the barriers is set into the floor of the tower. See the "{@area Features of Cael Morrow|27b|x}" section for more information on the magical barriers and keystones.
As they traverse this hall, the characters can see a deep reddish glow to the east (emanating from the ruidium spines in {@area area M17|2ce|x}).

entries.name: M5a: Crumbling Guard Tower

entries: Cold water drips from above as the wards surrounding this ruined tower flicker. Resting in a shallow indentation in the middle of the floor is a stone cube six inches on a side that hisses and sparks.

The first time the characters enter this area, one among them (determined randomly) receives a telepathic message from the Alyxian Aboleth (see "{@area Poisoned Emotions|282|x}" earlier in the chapter).

Characters who have a passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score of 15 or higher notice the silhouette of a giant shark circling the tower. As long as the barriers remain in place, the shark doesn't pose a threat.

entries.name: Malfunctioning Keystone
entries: Any character who examines the keystone closely and succeeds on a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check determines that its magic is weakening, but there's no way to tell when it will cease to function. The Allegiance of Allsight explorers in Cael Morrow are unaware of the problem, since the keystone began to malfunction only recently.

It's only a matter of time before the faulty keystone fails, causing the barriers around the tower and the barriers that protect the adjoining hallways to disappear. Removing the keystone from the floor also causes this to happen. In its defective state, this cube has 25 hit points instead of the normal 50.

If the characters leave the keystone undisturbed, they can pass through the tower safely and continue onward. If any of them return to the tower a second time, the keystone makes a loud popping noise in their presence and cracks in half, bringing down the magical barriers. The shark, which is a {@creature corrupted giant shark|CRCotN} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}), attacks characters who now find themselves underwater.

entries.name: M6: Sunken Tavern
entries: This stone-walled tavern is underwater. Sections of its exterior walls have collapsed, leaving openings through which the interior can be seen:

Cracked stone tiles and fields of kelp surround a submerged building with light emanating from its interior. Through a hole in one wall, you see a blue-skinned elf with long, white hair. It's hard to see exactly what she's doing from this viewpoint, but she appears to be tending bar.

{@spell Continual flame} spells illuminate the interior of this underwater tavern, which is strewn with detritus. A neutral good sea elf named {@creature Olara|CRCotN} floats behind a granite countertop. If approached, the barkeep cheerfully introduces herself and welcomes the characters to what she calls the Last Willow Tavern. {@creature Olara|CRCotN} uses the {@creature scout} stat block, with these changes:

items: She has a swimming speed equal to her walking speed, and she can breathe air and water.
She has {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.
She has resistance to cold damage and advantage on saving throws to end the {@condition charmed} condition on herself. Magic can't put her to sleep.

entries: {@creature Olara|CRCotN} speaks an ancient dialect that formed the basis for both Elvish and Orc, and any character who speaks and understands either of those languages can converse with her. This is a trait she shares with some of the ghosts of her kinfolk that still haunt the ruins of Cael Morrow, but {@creature Olara|CRCotN} is no ghost; she is one of the few mortals who survived Gruumsh's attack centuries ago. She subsists on the kelp growing throughout the Drowned City.

Decades spent near the Netherdeep and the Alyxian Aboleth have damaged {@creature Olara|CRCotN}'s memories. A few of the Allegiance of Allsight archaeologists have interacted with {@creature Olara|CRCotN}, to no avail, and since she shows no sign of hostility toward their efforts, they have decided to leave her alone.

entries.name: Buying Goods from Olara
entries: {@creature Olara|CRCotN} treats the characters as she would patrons of her tavern in any normal setting, commenting on the fact that, though the tavern is out of food and spirits, she can still offer some special brews. If the characters humor her, {@creature Olara|CRCotN} shows off her collection of mundane wines and magic potions—their containers all tightly sealed. Characters can purchase any of these items:

items.name: Magically Preserved Wine.
items.entry: {@creature Olara|CRCotN} has three bottles of this delicious, pre-Divergence vintage in stock and asks 50 gp per bottle. An Ank'Hareli sommelier will pay up to 1,000 gp for a bottle of this rare vintage.

items.name: Potions of Healing.
items.entry: {@creature Olara|CRCotN} has five of {@item Potion of Healing||potions of healing} in stock and sells them for 50 gp each.

items.name: Potions of Heroism.
items.entry: {@creature Olara|CRCotN} has two {@item Potion of Heroism||potions of heroism} in stock and sells them for 300 gp each.

entries.name: Clearing Olara's Mind
entries: The haze that clouds {@creature Olara|CRCotN}'s mind is magically induced, a result of many years spent near the Alyxian Aboleth and the Netherdeep. Any magic that ends a curse cures {@creature Olara|CRCotN}'s affliction. Killing the aboleth also ends the effect.

If the characters ask {@creature Olara|CRCotN} about Alyxian after clearing her mind, she fondly recalls serving wine to him on one occasion. She remembers Alyxian as a haunted and tragic figure, but beautiful in a way.

entries.name: M7: Hall of the Royal Library
entries: A dry, air-filled hallway enclosed by magical barriers and illuminated by {@spell continual flame} spells runs along the south side of a crumbling stone building. The keystone that maintains the hallway's barriers is set above the western door. See the "Features of Cael Morrow" section for more information on the magical barriers and keystones.

A door in the north wall of the corridor leads to a dry, air-filled library (area M7a). A door in the south wall has a flooded chamber ({@area area M8|2a7|x}) beyond it, with a protective barrier across the doorway that holds back the water. A door at the east end of the hallway has a similar barrier, through which characters can see the Temple of the Arch Heart ({@area area M9|2ad|x}).

entries.name: M7a: Royal Reading Room
entries: Magical barriers enclose this room, keeping the water out. The room's keystone is set above the south door. If the keystone is destroyed or taken from this area, the barriers around the room disappear, causing water to burst in through the north doors and seep through cracks in the walls and roof. It takes 1 minute for the room to become entirely flooded. See the "{@area Features of Cael Morrow|27b|x}" section for more information on the magical barriers and keystones.
The first time the characters enter this area, read or paraphrase the following:

Even though this magically illuminated room has been drained of water, the smell of rotting, waterlogged wood fills the air. Bookshelves lining the walls are filled with tomes and scrolls that have been turned to mush by centuries of submersion.

A female elf is sifting through the room's detritus, seeming exasperated. Standing near her but looking in your direction is a ten-foot-tall construct, its bipedal form made of metal, stone, and wood.

A neutral evil, high elf {@creature occult extollant|CRCotN} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}) named {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} has set up camp in this room along with Crescent, her {@creature shield guardian}. {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} wears the {@item Master's Amulet|MM|shield guardian's amulet} around her neck but hides it under her shirt.
Modify {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN|Galeokaerda's} stat block as follows:

items: {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} speaks Celestial, Common, and Elvish.
She has {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.
She has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

entries: As described in the faction story tracks in {@adventure chapter 4|CRCotN|4}, {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} has long posed as a professor of the Allegiance of Allsight and has become {@skill Insight}'s friend. Now she regrets betraying her friend and secretly hopes that she can convince {@skill Insight} to turn against the Allegiance of Allsight when {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} and the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream take over Cael Morrow.

entries.title: {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN}

entries: If the characters are on a mission that doesn't involve {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN}, she tells them to get lost while claiming that she's doing research for the Allegiance of Allsight. If the characters refuse to leave, she threatens to unleash her shield guardian. But if the characters call her bluff, she doesn't follow through on her threat, afraid that doing so will lead to her defeat. If the characters attack {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} or Crescent, however, the two of them react in kind.

{@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} is suspicious of anyone she doesn't recognize, even someone affiliated with the Consortium. If the characters are on a mission that involves {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} and portray themselves as fellow explorers, she demands that they prove their worth by retrieving a clay tablet, which she describes as having a "sigil sequence" inscribed on it, from area M7b. If they do so, she tells them that she has identified the location of the Key to the Netherdeep: a ruined villa on the southern cliffs ({@area area M13|2be|x}).

entries.name: Double Agent
entries: At the end of any conversation with {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN}, a character can discern her true intentions and affiliation by making a successful DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. Any character who observes {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} closely can, with a successful DC 15 Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check, spot the telltale markings of ruidium corruption on her arms. If a character calls attention to the marks, {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} hastily tries to explain how she got them in the line of duty; then she realizes that any explanation is fruitless and attacks.

entries.name: M7b: Royal Study Chamber
entries: This damaged, water-filled chamber contains a hungry {@creature swarm of sorrowfish|CRCotN} (see {@adventure appendix A|CRCotN|8}).

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Lying on the floor in the middle of the room is a {@item teleportation tablet|CRCotN} (see {@adventure appendix B|CRCotN|9|{@item Teleportation Tablet|CRCotN}}) that was left behind by a member of the Consortium of the Vermilion Dream. This individual was searching the area for relics when a giant shark entered through a hole in the roof. The agent panicked and fled, dropping the tablet on their way back to area M7a. {@creature Galeokaerda|CRCotN} wants to acquire the tablet, which connects to a teleportation circle on the roof of First Eclipse in Ank'Harel's Suncut Bazaar (see {@area chapter 4|1c4|x}).

entries.name: M7c: Royal Ritual Chamber
entries: This flooded chamber has been stripped bare by water and time.

The first time the characters enter this area, one among them (determined randomly) receives a telepathic message from the Alyxian Aboleth (see "{@area Poisoned Emotions|282|x}" earlier in the chapter).

A character who spends at least 1 minute searching the area can make a DC 14 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check, uncovering a permanent teleportation circle on a success. A character who knows this circle's sigil sequence (which can be learned by studying the circle for 1 minute) can teleport to it using the {@spell teleportation circle} spell.

entries.name: M8: Submerged Library

entries: Broken clay tablets inscribed with writing lie among the detritus of this former library. What were once polished marble shelves are now coral-encrusted ruins overgrown with kelp. The shattered remains of a circular glass window give off flashes of reddish light.

The first time the characters enter this area, one among them (determined randomly) receives a telepathic message from the Alyxian Aboleth (see "{@area Poisoned Emotions|282|x}" earlier in the chapter).

The writing on the tablets is in a script that has elements familiar to anyone who understands Elvish or Orc. Any character who spends at least 10 minutes searching through the detritus can make a DC 13 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check, finding three unbroken tablets amid the rubble on a success.

When placed side by side in the proper order, the three tablets tell the story of the gathering of elves across Exandria; the blessing of Corellon upon their settlement, Cael Morrow; and the birth of the first orcs. Before the tablets can be manipulated in this way, however, the characters must deal with the ancient ghosts that haunt them.

entries.name: Haunted Tablets
entries: Each of the three unbroken tablets is inhabited by a lawful neutral {@creature ghost}, desperate for a peaceful end to its suffering. When a Humanoid first touches a tablet, the ghost inside tries to possess the creature using its Possession action. If the creature resists that attempt, the ghost appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the tablet. After one ghost has emerged from its tablet, whether by possessing a creature or otherwise, the other two ghosts appear alongside it.

Two of the ghosts look like male elves, and the third looks like a female orc. All three are dressed in elegant robes trimmed with fine embroidery. The ghosts are not hostile; they try to possess creatures only so they can share their stories and thus find peace after death, but they defend themselves if attacked. While possessing a creature, a ghost moves the creature's body as far from combat as possible and doesn't force the creature to attack.

Any character who is possessed by one of the ghosts experiences a vision of the ghost's past life: their families and friends, the shining alabaster spires of their city in its prime, and the frantic attempts at evacuation as Gruumsh began his assault. The vision ends with a scene showing the two elves and the orc in a splendid library, about to sacrifice their lives in a futile attempt to preserve their history so that those they loved would not be forgotten. They look out from a library window and behold a nearby temple. A lone warrior with a spear and shield—Alyxian—stands atop the building. He is cast in shadow while the hundred-foot-tall figure of Gruumsh looms over him and laughs. As Gruumsh's spear descends on the temple, the vision goes dark. The vision takes 1 minute to play out in full. When it is over, the ghost ends the possession.

entries.name: Speaking with the Ghosts
entries: Characters who speak Elvish or Orc can converse with the ghosts, who speak an ancient dialect that forms the basis for both modern languages. The ghosts respect Alyxian the Apotheon, who they believe died in a vain attempt to defy Gruumsh. They know little about Alyxian beyond his divine connection to Sehanine, Avandra, and Corellon, and they are unaware of the Netherdeep and the existence of ruidium.

entries.name: Laying the Dead to Rest
entries: The ghosts find peace if they are reassured that they and their city will be remembered. A character can try to bring peace to the ghosts by offering reassuring words and then making a DC 12 Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check. A character who was possessed by one of the ghosts has advantage on the check. On a successful check, the ghosts thank the character before disappearing in a shimmer of light. As a token of the ghosts' gratitude, the character gains {@book inspiration|PHB|4|inspiration} (see the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB}). On a failed check, the ghosts are not laid to rest, and further attempts by that character to reassure the ghosts fail automatically.

entries.title: Divine magic keeps water from flooding the temple of Corellon in the sunken heart of Cael Morrow

entries.name: M9: Temple of the Arch Heart

entries: A once-majestic stone temple stands in the middle of a sunken courtyard. Alabaster pillars, glowing softly, surround the open area. Pulsing red light issues from an archway that leads inside the temple.

Characters who have a passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score of 15 or higher notice a distortion in the light filtering through the water between the alabaster pillars and the center of the temple. The pillars project an {@condition invisible} protective dome of divine magic around the temple. Only characters who are accompanied by a devout worshiper of Corellon can pass through this dome; otherwise, the dome can't be penetrated, is immune to all damage, and can't be dispelled in any way. If no characters in the party meet this requirement, the ghost of one of Corellon's priests can be found in {@area area M14|2c2|x}.

entries.name: Temple Interior
entries: If the characters move to a position where they can see through the archway in the temple's south wall, read:

The interior of the temple is dry. Lavishly sculpted pillars line the interior walls, and the floor is adorned with a mosaic of silver and green glass that depicts two verdant crescent moons atop a four-pointed star. At the center of the mosaic is a red crystal shard, pulsing with light in a mockery of a heartbeat. Scarlet tendrils radiate from it and crawl across the stonework. Against the north wall stands a statue of Corellon.

The air in the temple is fresh and smells faintly of incense, although the source of the odor is not apparent.
